intro: Erysimum hamosum, commonly known as the hoary whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are hairy and grayish-green, and its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in racemes. It is a herbaceous annual that blooms from spring to early summer.
